title: Which generation was the first to grow up with computers? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depending on your view of the demographics, the First generation to grow up with “Personal Computers” are the Gen-X (1965–1984), the children of the Boom Generation (1946–1964) [Demographers count 20 years as a generation] Apple started in a Garage in about 1975 by 2 Boomers, both named Steve. IBM introduced the IBM-PC in August 1981 after Apple’s 1976–77 Apple II. The Gen-Y a.k.a. “Millennials” (1996–2015) are the true First computer generation. They can be recognized by head bruises and broken glasses from running into vertical structures while texting. Cursive script is unknown to them as would be TV on three networks. Johnny Carson, Ed Sullivan, Mary Tiller Moore, and Farrah Fawcett and Michel Jackson are just names. Just so you know, I’m a boomer who draws strength and encouragement from the Y’s & Z’s who have adopted me as a credible OG.<G>

Probably mine. I was born in ’73 and we got our first home computer in the early 80s. We always had some sort of computer in the house and made the switch in the 90s to PCs and “The Internet”. Computers were extremely formative for my generation and I don’t think there was much time when I didn’t either have access to or own at least one.
